intro: Melampyrum sylvaticum subsp. subsilvaticum, commonly known as the woodland touch-me-not, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It is a member of the Fabaceae family, characterized by its trifoliate leaves and distinctive yellow-orange flowers. The subspecies subsilvaticum typically grows in shaded, moist environments such as woodlands and stream sides. It produces small, bean-like pods that contain seeds dispersed by wind. This plant is often found in association with other shade-tolerant flora in forest understories.
